intro: Disperma transvaalense, commonly known as the Transvaal bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Disperma transvaalense is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
